result.markdown: --- title: "\U0001F4CE Correlations" subtitle: "Correlations" author: "Arvind Venkatadri" date: 22/Nov/2022 date-modified: "2023-03-12" order: 30 abstract: "How one variable changes with another" image: preview.jpg image-alt: image from rawpixel.com categories: - Correlations - Scatter Plots - Bubble Plots - 2D Density Plots - Heatmaps - Regression Lines --- # {{< fa folder-open >}} Slides and Tutorials | | | | | |----------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | R Tutorial   | Orange Tutorial | Radiant Tutorial  | Datasets | # Setup the Packages ::: {.cell hash='intro-corr_cache/html/setup_da65fe5c8dfc1c593697c4558b58225d'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(palmerpenguins) library(patchwork) library(ggformula) library(mosaic) library(GGally) library(corrplot) #library(grid) ``` ::: # What graphs will we see today? Some of the very basic and commonly used plots for data are: - Scatter Plot - Contour Plot - Correlogram - Heatmap ## What Correlation Charts can we plot with Numerical / Quantitative Data? ::: {.cell hash='intro-corr_cache/html/charts_881a4789119b2dcc989ccb7fbb466c47'} ```{.r .cell-code} mpg <- mpg %>% mutate(drv= as_factor(drv)) p <- ggplot(mpg, alpha = 0.3) p1 <- gf_point(cty ~ hwy, fill = ~drv, colour = ~drv, data = mpg) %>% gf_smooth(method = "lm", title = "Scatter Plot with Correlation/Regression/Trend Line") p2 <- gf_density_2d(cty~hwy, data = mpg, title = "2D Density Plot") p1 + p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](intro-corr_files/figure-html/charts-1.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='intro-corr_cache/html/pairs-charts_b578f6410e5e621c652b675b1eaa09f7'} ```{.r .cell-code} p2 <- GGally::ggpairs(mpg, columns = c("hwy", "cty", "displ","cyl"), diag = list("densityDiag"), title = "Pairwise Correlations Plot") p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](intro-corr_files/figure-html/pairs-charts-1.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='intro-corr_cache/html/cor-plot_89e0ba9df0f35320361006c00e93dfed'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(corrplot) mpg_num <- mpg %>% select(hwy, cty, displ, cyl) mydata_cor <- cor(mpg_num) corrplot(mydata_cor,method = "ellipse",type = "lower",main = "Correlogram") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](intro-corr_files/figure-html/cor-plot-1.png){width=4200} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Heatmap with numbers corrplot.mixed(mydata_cor, lower = "color", upper = "number", bg = "wheat", tl.pos = "d", main = "Heatmap?") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](intro-corr_files/figure-html/cor-plot-2.png){width=4200} ::: ::: ## A Workflow in Orange How does one calculate and visualize Correlations in Orange? {{< video https://youtu.be/Bd7n9FdY3g0 >}} Here is the help page on Correlations in Orange: ::: {.cell hash='intro-corr_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_4913445e6a595c2c3339479a161a8e0a'} ::: ## References 1.
